intro: Dalechampia maxima, commonly known as the giant dalechampia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its latex is milky and can be used in traditional medicine, though it is toxic if ingested.
